USE SOMA
presents:

SOMADEX

First Compliant Multi-asset DEX & Issuance Platform For Tokenized Equities, Crypto Assets, STOs, and NFTs

be the first to know
Cross-Chain

Access tokens on multiple blockchains.

P2P

Trade directly with other users using smart contracts.

Compliant

U.S FINRA Compliant with Reg CF, Reg D, Reg S, and Reg A+ offerings.

Transparent

Every transaction is recorded on the blockchain.

Crypto, STOs and NFTs

We will be the first leading Crypto + STO exchange.

Secure

SOMA DEX is completely non-custodial.

FIAT Convertable

On/Off ramps for FIAT conversions.

Tokenized Equities

Including after hours equities trading of key stocks.

World’s first Hybrid DEX

Our hybrid DEX combines the best of both worlds; a regulated aspect which gives confidence to institutional investors through our compliant implemention of KYC and AML restrictions, as well as offering flexibility to projects through the permissionless nature of allowing offerings and trading using smart contracts.

Tokenized Securities

We will be joining FTX, Binance, and others by offering tokenized stocks, but what will be unique with SOMA is that our trading will be fully decentralized and what we call “semi-permissionless” in that users will have no restrictions after their KYC allowing for trading to be truly P2P.

DECENTRALIZATION ENSURES THAT THERE WILL BE NO FRONT RUNNING OR MANIPULATION OF THE ORDERS

$SOMA

$SOMA will be US compliant under Reg CF (Crowdfunding), Reg D, and Reg S offerings.

The $SOMA token, as a compliant security, will allow for:

  • Discounts on fees
  • Dividends and airdrops
  • Burns and buybacks
  • Staking of liquidity pools and earning interest 
  • Staking of insurance fund % of profit from platform plus interest

$SOMA Tokenomics

Tokenomics

SOMA Roadmap

01

Phase 1 - Initiate

Crypto Assets, Compliant Digital Securities & NFTs

  • Wallet Integration (MyEtherWallet, MetaMask, Wallet Connect, Wallet Link, etc.)
  • Incorporate third party whitelisted wallets APIs & databases.
  • Whitelisted wallet addresses that are in our KYC/AML registered database.
  • Autonomous payment of commissions to the key parties in each transaction.
  • Ability to white label and reskin the interface for other partnered exchanges.
  • Cross chain swaps ETH <-> Polkadot, etc.

02

Phase 2 - Enhance

Additional trading functionality

  • Enhanced order types (e.g., limit orders) and conditions.
  • Market surveillance engine.
  • Integrate tokenized stocks such as Tesla,  Spacex, Draft Kings, etc. with P2P 24/7 trading.
  • Add outside crypto liquidity providers

03

Phase 3 - Brokerage

Open the ecosystem

  • Allow whitelisted, external brokers to enter an order where they share commission automatically
  • External brokers can enter in shared KYC/AML information to register the wallet on our system via API, with information checked & updated if necessary every time a connection is made.
  • Pari-Mutuel options, futures & synthetics.
  • FIX protocols to integrate to legacy financial systems.

04

Phase 4 - Expand

Plug in to other outside exchanges for shared liquidity

  • Minerals, precious metals, oil & other commodity assets in tokenized form.
  • Borrow & margin where the P2P liquidity provider gets the majority of loan interest.
  • Integrate additional chains and wallets.
  • Integrate cross-blockchain exchange of assets (Ethereum <-> Polkadot  <-> Solana, etc.)

  • Wallet Integration (MyEtherWallet, MetaMask, Wallet Connect, Wallet Link, etc.)
  • Incorporate third party whitelisted wallet APIs & databases.
  • Whitelisted wallet addresses that are in our KYC/AML registered database.
  • Autonomous payment of commissions to the key parties in each transaction.
  • Ability to white label and reskin the interface for other partnered exchanges.
  • Cross chain swaps ETH <-> Polkadot, etc.
  • Enhanced order types (e.g., limit orders) and conditions.
  • Market surveillance engine.
  • Integrate tokenized equities and ETFs such as Tesla, AMC, Draft Kings, etc. with P2P 24/7 trading.
  • Add outside crypto liquidity providers
  • Allow whitelisted, external brokers to enter an order where they share commission automatically
  • External brokers can enter in shared KYC/AML information to register the wallet on our system via API, with information checked & updated if necessary every time a connection is made.
  • Pari-Mutuel options, futures & synthetics.
  • FIX protocols to integrate to legacy financial systems.
  • Minerals, precious metals, oil & other commodity assets in tokenized form.
  • Borrow & margin where the P2P liquidity provider gets the majority of loan interest.
  • Integrate additional chains and wallets.
  • Integrate cross-blockchain exchange of assets (Ethereum <-> Polkadot  <-> Solana, etc.)

Team and Advisors

William Heyn
William Heyn
Bill is the founder and Chief Executive Officer of Tritaurian. A nearly thirty-year financial industry veteran, he founded Tritaurian to provide high quality investment banking services to clients of all sizes. He has previously held positions at Merrill Lynch, J.P. Morgan and Morgan Stanley, and currently holds FINRA Series 7, 24, 63, 79 and 99 licenses. Bill is a graduate of Yale University.
John Patrick Mullin
John Patrick Mullin
John Patrick Mullin is a FinTech entrepreneur, investor, and educator living in Hong Kong. He’s a Co-founder of MANTRA DAO, a popular Decentralized Finance (DeFi) savings and lending platform. He also has a traditional investment banking background having worked at Guotai Junan Securities in Shanghai, China. As an educator, he has spoken at leading universities across the world, including Harvard, London Business School, and Peking University. Additionally, John is an active angel investor in blockchain and FinTech startups having invested in over 40+ companies across both equity & tokens.
James Preissler
James Preissler
Jim is a Managing Partner of Tritaurian and a member of its board of directors. Jim has over 20 years of international business experience with a deep private equity and investment banking background. Jim also holds multiple FINRA licenses including Series 7, 24, 63, 79 and 99, and is a graduate of Yale University.
Will Corkin
Will Corkin
Will is a blockchain & FinTech entrepreneur in both the crypto and tokenized securities markets. Helping to structure and launch over 20 blockchain companies while running the consulting and advisory arm of trade.io, Will more recently headed business development for the only US broker-dealer currently licensed to issue and distribute security tokens. Prior to his involvement in blockchain, he was a portfolio manager at ZX Ventures.
Ken Norensberg
Ken Norensberg
Ken is the Managing Director of Luxor Financial Group, a compliance and business development firm specializing in merger and acquisitions of regulated entities. Ken is also a former Member of the FINRA Board of Governors.
Rodrigo Quan Miranda
Rodrigo Quan Miranda
Rodrigo is a former Hong Kong based investment banker turned emerging technology entrepreneur. He is the founder of Moon Street Ventures, an emerging technology consulting and R&D company, as well as co-founder and CEO at Immutable Technologies Corp. (‘ITC’), a blockchain infrastructure provider. Prior to ITC, Rodrigo worked in investment banking at Willis Towers Watson Securities (‘WTWS’) in NYC and HK. Rodrigo received his B.A. in Economics from Amherst College in Amherst, Massachusetts, and is a passionate computer science student in his spare time.
Lachlan Greenbank
Lachlan Greenbank
Lachlan is an Australian software developer who specialises in building web3 applications. After winning 1st prize at the Australian EOS Hackathon in 2018, Lachlan founded and operated Smartpress, a Sydney-based Blockchain Development firm. He is responsible for overseeing the technical and product teams at SOMA.
Adam Zerella
Adam Zerella
Adam is a software engineer who specialises in highly-scalable web and blockchain based applications. With nearly a decade of experience building and leading high-profile projects within the public and private sector. Adam has previously worked for the Australian government, Hewlett-Packard, Honeywell among countless start-ups. He has contributed to literally hundreds of open-source projects such as the Linux kernel, Facebook, Google, JavaScript EMCA specifications, TypeScript community among many others. He has a keen eye for security, testing, performance and architecture whilst he is working his magic.
Caleb Power
Caleb Power
Caleb L. Power is a DevSecOps Engineer from the United States, with degrees in computer science, software engineering, digital forensics, and mathematics. He is the founder of the Edmond Professional Chapter of the Association for Computing Machinery and currently serves as the Chief Executive Officer of Axonibyte Innovations, where he promotes advances in computing in fields ranging from blockchain technology to medical IT infrastructure. In his limited free time, he works on open source software and can sometimes be seen gaming or catching up on his TV shows.
Jayant Ramanand
Jayant Ramanand
Jayant is an eternal optimist with a sense of humour. Strategy & Operations Manager at MANTRA DAO. He likes to connect with people and help find solutions to seemingly impossible problems.

At this time, this Site is for informational purposes only.  By accessing this Site and any pages on this Site, you agree to be bound by its Terms of Use and Privacy Policy as may be amended from time to time without notice or liability. SOMADEX is not the issuing entity, a registered broker-dealer, or crowdfunding portal, and is not acting in a regulated capacity in any way in connection with the proposed issuance of the securities referenced on this Site. SOMADEX has partnered with TTC, a registered Broker-Dealer and member of FINRA and SIPC, located at 430 Park Avenue, 19th Floor, New York, New York, and any securities referenced on this site will be offered through TTC. You can view the TTC BrokerCheck record here and reach their website here.
